Classes/Router.html.name: Router
Classes/Router.html.abstract: Router provides the external interface for routing requests to

Classes/Kitura.html.name: Kitura
Classes/Kitura.html.abstract: Facilities for creating, starting and stopping Kitura-based servers.

Classes/RouterMiddlewareGenerator.html.name: RouterMiddlewareGenerator
Classes/RouterMiddlewareGenerator.html.abstract: Create an on the fly RouterMiddleware from a RouterHandler closure.

Classes/RouterRequest.html.name: RouterRequest
Classes/RouterRequest.html.abstract: The RouterRequest class is used to interact with incoming HTTP requests to the Router.

Classes/RouterResponse.html.name: RouterResponse
Classes/RouterResponse.html.abstract: The RouterResponse class is used to define and work with the response that will be sent by the Router.

Classes/BodyParser.html.name: BodyParser
Classes/BodyParser.html.abstract: The BodyParser parses the body of the request prior to sending it to the handler. It reads the Content-Type of the message header and populates the RouterRequest body field with a corresponding ParsedBody enumeration.

Classes/BodyParserMultiValue.html.name: BodyParserMultiValue
Classes/BodyParserMultiValue.html.abstract: The BodyParserMultiValue is a subclass of BodyParser, which differs in behaviour

Classes/ContentType.html.name: ContentType
Classes/ContentType.html.abstract: The ContentType class provides functions to determine the MIME content type for a given file extension. The user can pass in a complete file name e.g. “foo.png” or just the file extension e.g. “png”, or they can pass in both a MIME content type and a file extension and query whether they match.

Classes/StaticFileServer.html.name: StaticFileServer
Classes/StaticFileServer.html.abstract: A router middleware that serves static files from a given path.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
